Hi Tom,

> I’m not sure if there is a zendesk ticket for ad related issues,

There isn't a ticket specifically for ad tags, although do feel free to open a new one (I have just opened a ticket for this issue, in fact this is that very ticket!)

btw. it's probably best to open a new ticket per issue or group of related issues, that way we don't end up with tickets that never get closed.

> http://www.london2012.com/planning/ - Can we please remove tags from this page

Have removed the tags, but I still need to bulk republish that section.

> http://www.london2012.com/get-involved/volunteer/young-games-makers/have-you-got-what-it-takes-.php
> Seems to have a banner on already, though not nessecarily the correct tag.
> Tag for this section should be: pgs_get-involved_volunteer/young-games-makers. All others in the CMS have this ad tag.

That's the tag the page has already? (view the page source)
var tags='pgs_get-involved_volunteer/young-games-makers'

I have mentioned this already to Erin, but probably worth re-iterating, the tags are *auto-generated* based on the section hierarchy in the CMS.

We have added in some special rules for keys sections ie. news/blogs/photos and the games/venue sections.

But there really is no notion of changing a tag on an individual page (we did do this for a BP/Arts page, but that was meant to be no more than a stop gap until we modified the CMS to allow you to assign/override the tag on a specific page). We can't continue to add 'per page' executions into the code base, we really need to keep it clean and limited to outputting tag from the standard logic or else we'll just end up with problems down the road.

In terms of tags that look wrong, if something looks wildly out then let us know (for example the year folder inside the photos sections meant that the standard logic for generating tags need to be slightly altered for those sections. But in general, the tags that are generated in the CMS should drive the DFP tags, rather than the other way round (as we don't have a config file where we can easily say these page or section get these tags).

Hope that makes sense

Jamie
Section is now republishing.

subject: Ceremonies application: phase 2
description: As discussed this morning.

comments.value: As discussed this morning.

15th August - Development 
5th September - Testing / minor amends
12th September - Ready for launch

Please find attached:
Definitive list of database fields
Session dates and times (the relevant columns are: Day, Date, Time of Day –e.g AM/PM/EVE, Exact Time, Session No. The last two columns are to do with the bibs that we will give out when people attend)

I think this is all you need to crack on - the spec has otherwise been approved.

Did you catch up with Campbell on the audition generation thread from our call on Monday?

Additional functional requirement - on the 'thank you' confirmation message, we need to include a link to a Diversity and Inclusion survey (which we will host and build using our survey tool), inviting people to complete the survey anonymously.

Also: the percussion auditions issue is no longer a problem. Percussionists will be handled by means of a different system, so they won't need to go through the audition route. The only issue with auditions now is how to ensure we only offer people a choice of auditions which still have space available - for discussion on Tues in our call with Campbell.

games/ceremonies/get-involved/ceremonies-application-update.php
games/ceremonies/get-involved/ceremonies-application-stage-two.php

Hi Morag,

Did Campbell create a DTD for the second phase, in terms of the exact field names he is expecting?

I have the Excel doc below but just realised we don't have the exact field name ie. previous-address (rather than the label Previous Address)

thanks

Jamie

btw. Danny is back now and looking after this project (although do cc me in with any tech questions or queries)

https://vip_staging_locog_www.london2012.com/ca/E97C7E8528A53F260657CD6BE8408124DEF543F8

Still to do:
 1. Test with more than one audition slot.
 2. Complete integration with Campbell's web API (once it's in place).
 3. Sensible error messages when:
    3.1. Hash is unrecognized.
    3.2. User has already completed this form.
 4. CSS/wording tweaks.
Proposal attached.

Hi Morag,

This is ready for review at the following URL:

https://vip_staging_locog_www.london2012.com/ca/E97C7E8528A53F260657CD6BE8408124DEF543F8

I am still making a few tweaks, but the thing that I'm most keen to get your feedback on is the wording, style, dropdown values, etc.

The link, above, is for MY ceremonies signup, and I suggest you use it for testing as it allows you to return and re-edit your details EVEN IF you've already filled in and saved your details.

From a technical p.o.v. you are not seeing LIVE audition dates. We are just using a hard-coded file supplied by Campbell.
Once his web api is up and running we will need to plug into it. Theoretically this should be relatively simple but ... we'll see!

Any questions, just ask.

Kieran

Thanks, Kieran. My comments below:

Intro text – there needs to be some fuller text here; will chase for this and forward asap.

General – on the spreadsheet with the data fields there is a column for ‘Associated text’ with some important information e.g. ‘Family name must be as it appears on your identification document’ etc. Is the best way to do this as tooltips using the ‘i’ icon we originally had for phase 1? These explanatory notes are important, as some of the fields they are asking for don’t make sense on their own

Sentence case for all field labels i.e. ‘Family name’ rather than ‘Family Name’ and ‘Preferred given name’ rather than ‘Preferred Given name’

Gender – the values requested by Ceremonies are ‘M=Male, F=Female’. I think therefore they want ‘M’ and ‘F’ rather than the full forms, and they want to remove the ‘Prefer not to say’ value from Phase 1. Is that a problem if you are pulling in data from Phase 1 and the applicant has only given ‘Prefer not to say’?

Identification type – apostrophe missing in ‘UK Driver’s Licence’

ID – I am pondering whether there is in fact an ID number on a birth certificate – surely not? I will check with Ceremonies whether this is in fact possible.

Country of issue for ID and Country of birth – dropdown isn’t wide enough for some of the values e.g. ‘United Kingdom of Great Britain and Northern Ireland’ – do we need this full version of the UK (did Campbell mandate this country list?) or could we just have ‘United Kingdom’?

Confirm email address field – this wasn’t on the original datasheet; also, won’t the email field be prepopulated from phase 1 (unless we are offering people the option to change the value?)

Background check – tweak question ‘Do you consent to background check?’ to ‘Do you consent to a background check?’

Declaration on Unspent Convictions – this doesn’t make sense grammatically or legally or whatever it’s supposed to do. I will check with Ceremonies team what it’s supposed to be....

‘Do you have any accessibility requirements in order to undergo the audition process’ – missing a question mark

‘If you answered yes to the above question, which of the above do you require?’ – please change to ‘If you answered yes to the above question, which of the above apply to you?’

‘In the event of you being cast as a Ceremonies Volunteer Performer. Do you have any dietary requirements’ – please change to ‘In the event of you being cast as a Ceremonies Volunteer Performer, do you have any dietary requirements?’

‘We are interested in whether you have any specific performance skills?’ – please change to ‘We are interested in whether you have any specific performance skills. Please check all which apply.’

Values for skills – please make these sentence case e.g. ‘Circus skills’

Typo in ‘Parrellel Skating’ – change to ‘Parallel skating’

Reminder on length of committement and compulsary dates – can we have the checkbox at the bottom of this statement rather than at the top?. Also two typos – should be ‘Reminder on length of commitment and compulsory dates’

Terms and conditions – we need to link to these (open in a new window) at https://www.london2012.com/games/ceremonies/get-involved/terms-and-conditions.php

‘By submitting this form, and having read the FAQs [insert hyperlink to relevant FAQ]....’ - replace text in square brackets with link from ‘FAQs’ to https://www.london2012.com/games/ceremonies/get-involved/faqs.php

Link to Diversity and Inclusion Form<https://vip_staging_locog_www.london2012.com/> – this needs to be removed from the actual sign-up form and should be displayed on the confirmation screen after the thank you message – it should link to the page http://survey.london2012.com/survey/386255/125c/ (I am still building this page, so ignore the resemblance to the Torch Relay D&I form)

I was expecting that the link would only work once – is it a security risk to allow people to access submitted data (if the link gets shared, for example)?

I will chase Campbell re: his audition dates api – sorry you haven’t had it before now. Are you waiting for other things from him?

Phew, that’s a lot. Happy to chat through these. Do you think by the end of the day most of these changes will be in place? Keen to share with the Ceremonies team so they can test.

Thank you so much!

Morag

 https://www.london2012.com/games/ceremonies/get-involved/ceremonies-application.php
and I don't see any (i) icons. Did they get removed at some stage?

Kieran

This is quite a long message. I will send a supplementary email JUST detailing the items that still need your/other's attention. > 1. Intro text – there needs to be some fuller text here; will chase for this and forward asap. You are able to edit this yourself: https://new2012.kitsite.com/kit/pages/edit/games/ceremonies/get-involved/ceremonies-application-stage-two.php > 2. General – on the spreadsheet with the data fields there is a column for ‘Associated text’ with some important information e.g. ‘Family name must be as it appears on your identification document’ etc. Is the best way to do this as tooltips using the ‘i’ icon we originally had for phase 1? These explanatory notes are important, as some of the fields they are asking for don’t make sense on their own The only piece of explanatory text that I see on the original is below the UK postcode box. https://www.london2012.com/games/ceremonies/get-involved/ceremonies-application.php and I don't see any (i) icons. Did they get removed at some stage? > 3. Sentence case for all field labels i.e. ‘Family name’ rather than ‘Family Name’ and ‘Preferred given name’ rather than ‘Preferred Given name’ Agree entirely - was (rather naively) following what was supplied! > 4. Gender – the values requested by Ceremonies are ‘M=Male, F=Female’. Also two typos – should be ‘Reminder on length of commitment and compulsory dates’ Alignment is a little tricky. I will need to get Lars to look at this (but not right now as he's tied up with YGM form). > 18. Link to Diversity and Inclusion Form – this needs to be removed from the actual sign-up form and should be displayed on the confirmation screen after the thank you message – it should link to the page http://survey.london2012.com/survey/386255/125c/ (I am still building this page, so ignore the resemblance to the Torch Relay D&I form) Removed.
Link to Diversity and Inclusion Form
> 21. I tried to submit the form but got an error message ‘Sorry, there was an error processing your request. Please report this.’ That is obviously not expected behaviour. Are you able to reproduce? > 22. Thank you message – change to ‘Thank you. Your details have been received and we will be in touch in the near future with confirmation of your audition details including date, time and venue.’ Just so that I'm straight, you got an error the first time (21.) but no error the second time? I have added some special-case processing so that kieran@kitsite.com IS allowed to return and edit his data (otherwise this testing that we're doing right now would be very cumbersome!) > 24. I will chase Campbell re: his audition dates api – sorry you haven’t had it before now. Are you waiting for other things from him? It has been promised a number of times now. Most recently "by yesterday evening". I'm very keen to test against it ASAP, as there were differences even between the sample and the more detailed example. > Thank you so much! Not at all! Kieran

No longer true. See https://new2012.kitsite.com/kit/coder/_system/taxonomy/gm-countries.xml

Updates to the outstanding points (and a bit more, I'm afraid... ):

> D13. Terms and conditions link at bottom of form - please use this link instead http://www.london2012.com/games/ceremonies/get-involved/terms-and-conditions-for-auditionees.php
Done.

> D14. Country codes - can we talk about this please? Campbell doesn't mind what is displayed, but the code that comes through should be the ISO3166-1 Alpha 2 country code. Does your current dropdown list match that?
Done (as per separate conversation)

D1. Tooltips – I spoke to Jamie and he thought Lars had commented them out of the original phase 1 form so they may still be there if you uncomment them (she says hopefully)?

Some teeny teeny spots (and apologies if these are still showing because I am not looking at the latest version):

Family Name and Previous Family Name are still title case – please could they be sentence case?

ID number is still mandatory – should be non-mandatory
Background check – please could you tweak the text ‘All Ceremonies participants are required to undergo various security checking’ to read ‘All Ceremonies participants are required to undergo various security checks’
Accessibility tooltip ‘We will be holding prioritised accessible sessions at 13:00hrs on 10 and 12 November, which will be smaller in number and specifically designed.’ Change to ‘We will be holding prioritised accessible sessions at 13:00hrs on 10 and 12 November, which will be smaller in number and specifically designed for auditionees with accessibility requirements.’
Accessibility ‘I will require a Lip Speaker’- please make all sentence case

I just tried submitting the form now without the Ts and Cs box checked. It allowed me to do so (and gave me the ‘Sorry, we could not find your details. Please check that your email client did not truncate the url’ message, which seems wrong). Also, can I check the conditions in which you will receive this message normally – is it if the email address is not in our db? What if the user changes their email address from what they previously registered when populating the form?

Update! The go live for this now will be Tues rather than Monday. Which doesn’t give us that much more time, but hopefully makes it a bit less hectic.

Later today I am hoping we will have the test emails coming through; I’ve asked for an email to be sent to you for testing too!

Thanks for all your work on this – I’m sorry it’s been so arduous. [Would put a smiley here but there is no point....]

Hi Morag,
You're welcome. I'll keep a look out for the email.
Kieran

Hi Kieran

Not all the bugs noted last week seem to have been fixed – e.g. there’s still a star on the id number field.

I’ve had some feedback that ‘previous address’ seems to be mandatory (the tester put in a date of previous residence at this address of 15/08/11 which generated this response).

Also, as discussed last week, the accessibility auditions do not display in IE – see grab below. We were also going to add under ‘Please select your first choice of audition date’ the text about accessible auditions above?

[cid:image003.jpg@01CC71FC.A534A5D0]

morning.

Kieran

Hi Kieran

Kieran

If you have accessibility requirements select ‘yes’ above and select an available audition date below. You will be contacted by a member of staff to schedule and confirm your session.’

In the Auditions section please can you change the same text as in the Accessibility section.

subject: Festival: Events search Plan B?

comments.value: In case the events server is not ready in time for launch, how could we go about implementing some sort of events search using content entered into the CMS?

subject: Events database for London 2012
description:
---------- Forwarded message ----------
From: Services Tenders [ServicesTenders@london2012.com]
<ServicesTenders@london2012.com>
Date: 20 June 2011 17:06
Subject: Events database for London 2012
To:


The London Organising Committee of the Olympic and Paralympic Games
(LOCOG) requires an online events data management and publishing
service (events platform) to host and serve events listings to a
number of web and mobile applications for London 2012. This tool will
provide a single source for listing public-facing events from now to
the period of the London 2012 Olympic and Paralympic Games, including
cultural, community and big screen events. The events platform will be
capable of ingesting data from multiple sources, and outputting data
in industry-standard formats. It will also support access by multiple
users across a range of administration and publication roles.



LOCOG would like to invite you to tender for the provision of the
events database for London 2012



Before you can participate in the  ITT, you are required to:



1)            Complete and return the attached Competefor Template

2)            Sign and return the attached Confidentiality Agreement;

3)            Register your organisation on the LOCOG eTendering site; and

4)            Email this address with confirmation that you have registered.



Confidentiality Agreement

You are requested to return to LOCOG a signed copy of the attached
Confidentiality Agreement.  It will cover all dealings between LOCOG
and your organisation in relation to any proposal for the Games.



Please sign and scan a copy, then e-mail it to
ServicesTenders@london2012.com and return two hard copies for the
attention of Nicola Peers to the following address:

Procurement – LOCOG, 22nd Floor

1 Churchill Place

Canary Wharf

London E14 5LN.



LOCOG’s eTendering site

Bidders are required to register your organisation on the LOCOG
eTendering site. From here you will be able to access the ITT.



The process for registering your organisation on the LOCOG eTendering
site is as follows:

1.             Browse to the LOCOG eTendering site:
https://etenders.london2012.com/locog/

2.             Click the “Register for London 2012 eTendering” link in
the top left

3.             Click the “Register Now” link

4.             Read the terms and conditions, agree and click “continue”

5.             Enter your correct business and user details; you can
enter more than one email address if necessary using a semi-colon to
separate the email addresses

6.             Note the username you chose and click “Save” when complete

7.             You will shortly receive an email with your unique
password (please keep this secure)



Email confirmation of registration

When you have registered your organisation on the eTendering website,
please email confirmation of this to ServicesTenders@london2012.com
including the email address, company name and contact name that you
have registered under.



Once you have signed up, you will be invited to participate in the ITT
when it goes live. You will receive an email from the system telling
you when the ITT is live. The ITT is scheduled to go live Wed 22nd
June.



Kind regards



Services Tenders



London Organising Committee of the Olympic Games and Paralympic Games Ltd

One Churchill Place

Canary Wharf

London E14 5LN



Switchboard: +44 (0)20 3 2012 000

Fax: +44 (0) 203 2012 001

london2012.com





P Please consider the environment before printing this email



________________________________
The London Organising Committee of the Olympic Games and Paralympic
Games Limited
A company registered in England and Wales with its registered office
at One Churchill Place, Canary Wharf, London E14 5LN and registered
number 05267819

This E-mail is confidential. If you are not the addressee you may not
copy, forward, disclose or use any part of it. If you have received
this message in error, please delete it and all copies from your
system and notify the sender immediately by return E-mail.

Nothing in this message or its attachments is intended to create legal
relations between us unless there is an express statement creating
such relations or this message contains an authorised purchase order.

Internet communications cannot be guaranteed to be timely secure,
error or virus-free. The sender does not accept liability for any
errors or omissions.

http://www.london2012.com

________________________________

subject: Hidden business fields on sign up form causing issues
description:
Currently, when signing up at https://www.london2012.com/settings/register.php, the business fields are not displayed (style=visibility:hidden), but they are still on the page. This causes an issue when the user attempts to autocomplete the form fields: If any of the businessProfile fields are filled in, validation is done on the still-hidden fields, making it impossible to register.

A better solution is needed, possibly removing the business fields entirely (although we need to make sure that this does not cause business fields to then be wiped from the user record) or perhaps more safely ensuring that validation is not done on business fields unless reason=businessProfile.

Marking as high.

subject: Review of test procedures for london2012.com
description:
Morag has asked for us to review our testing proedures in order to avoid snafus finding their way onto the live site. 

Some suggestions:
- keep dev up to date
- php development on dev only
- global component changes on dev only
- no code deployment after 4pm
- use preview after making any changes
- don't leave changes on cms that could accidentally be published
- put a monitor up on the wall with london2012.com  permanently open in browser (and refreshing regularly)

comments.value:
Morag has asked for us to review our testing proedures in order to avoid snafus finding their way onto the live site. 

Some suggestions:
- keep dev up to date
- php development on dev only
- global component changes on dev only
- no code deployment after 4pm
- use preview after making any changes
- don't leave changes on cms that could accidentally be published
- put a monitor up on the wall with london2012.com  permanently open in browser (and refreshing regularly)

From Kieran (email):

CSS should not be published with syntax errors. Occasionally, of course, mistakes happen.
To ensure such mistakes don't cause broken css to appear on the live site, we should add a workflow trigger that runs whenever you click "publish" on a css asset.
This trigger should validate the css against the live w3c validator:
 http://jigsaw.w3.org/css-validator/api.html
using SOAP.
If any errors are found, an error should be raised, and the asset should NOT be published.
On the rare occasions when the validator is down, or if you really really want to publish some syntactically incorrect css, then you can manually amend the workflow, temporarily disabling the check.
Estimate: 1 days work.

PHP. It is similarly possible to mistakenly write template/container code which generates syntactically incorrect php code. We should amend the publication engine such that it runs "php -l" against each php file that it uploads, and refuses to upload any malformed php. This should be configurable via the publication target settings ("validate_php?").
Estimate: 1 days work.

Allowing for contingency, the above will probably take up to three days of my time.

subject: Javascript alert appearing in blog comments
description: The text, "onfocus="javascript:alert('XSS');: Congrats to Team GB and besting their former Personal Best!" is appearing in blog comments (see attachment). It's on this story: http://www.london2012.com/blog/2010/03/personal-bests-could-you-beat-yours-.php. I expect LOCOG will notice before too long and raise an issue. It would be nice to get it solved before they spot it.

It's on this story: http://www.london2012.com/blog/2010/03/personal-bests-could-you-beat-yours-.php. I expect LOCOG will notice before too long and raise an issue. It would be nice to get it solved before they spot it.

seems someone tried to do some xss attack (setting their name to: "onfocus="javascript:alert('XSS');:") but w/ no luck. Not a totally hopeless try though - we probably want to strip quotes and '<'s from user names just to avoid further excitement.

I didn't see an actual alert popping, did you? (if so that's mildly concerning - i'm having a quick look now)

Anyways, I've just realized comments are going through by the client actually approving them. I rejected it, should disappear eventually. We might want to friendly remind them not to accept comments from users with a funny username (like javascript:...) and an email like  'b00b@mailinator.com'.
To say the least! (although I really might have realized what you have just discovered for yourself, so sorry for wasting your time a bit--hopefully you found it mildly interesting at least)
ps I agree that stripping quotes and angle brackets would be a useful exercise (although I don't know how much work is involved).

We can do two ways: entry time and display time. Entry time is fewer places, but we need to convert the current database. Display time we have to look through each and every occasion when some user submitted content is displayed.

Or even better, if we're to approve every single user submitted content, we strip special charactes @ approval time, which means we don't have to change earlier comments (they already gone through safely) and there's a countable amount of entry points. It should be around .5 day multiplied by the number of content types we accept on l2012.

comments.value:
All looks good now this is live, thanks!

However, there is a problem with the nav and how it shows the splash / hub.

When you are on the hub, you can't see the hub or the splash in the left hand nav - see grab below.

When you are on a lower-level page you can see a page called 'II splash' in the left hand nav, but not the hub.  Am not that keen on showing 'Splash' in the left hand nav', but I do want it to be available in the nav.

Can we make the splash the entry point through the global nav, but not have it in the left hand nav when you are in the section? And can we make the hub page the main 'II home' in the left hand nav?

[cid:image001.png@01CBBE1F.8D7CC8A0]

Morag Reavley
New Media Manager
London Organising Committee of the Olympic Games and Paralympic Games
1 Churchill Place
Canary Wharf
London
Direct dial: 020 32012 160
Reception: 020 32012 000

Hi Morag,

I have changed the 'displayName' of the splash page so it should appear in navigation and the page title as just 'International Inspiration'

In terms of it appearing/not appearing the (proper) hub page is currently hidden from the navigation and the splash should show up instead (albeit now just called International Inspiration') so I think it is just a case of republishing pages that got published with the old 'International Inspiration Splash' link/title.

Ah... (just read your final line) "Can we make the splash the entry point through the global nav, but not have it in the left hand nav when you are in the section? "

This is *really* tricky as that navigation is completely encapsulated/logic based, will really have to have a hard think about how to do this / what is involved and do some experimenting on dev, it's not going to be simple and changing that nav will need proper testing as it effects the whole site.

Also "and can we make the hub page the main 'II home' in the left hand nav?"

That may be the simpler solution? Keep the navigation as it is (ie. splash page is not the index, it's just splash.php) and then just link direct to the splash page internally (when you want to) and/or setup a short url that takes users direct to the splash page if you send links in a mail out. 

Messing with that left hand nav in haste is probably not a great idea, it may be that (medium term) we could code a more generic solution that dealt with this situation, ie. allowed a Splash page to be used as to level page in a section. But as I said this will need some though. Another solution is we do something clever with cookies so that the user gets automatically redirected form the splash to the hub one they have seen that page (probably my preferred solution as it's more isolated than changing the local nav component).

If it helps you make a decision we won't be able to recode that left hand nav or do anything with cookies this week, 

So it will either have to stay as it it is (ie. the top level link always goes to the splash) or we keep it as it was previously and just link internally (from promos, text) to the splash page and direct people external users to it via a short url

Jamie

Thanks for this, Jamie.
I agree with your second solution: “Keep the navigation as it is (ie. splash page is not the index, it's just splash.php) and then just link direct to the splash page internally (when you want to) and/or setup a short url that takes users direct to the splash page if you send links in a mail out.”

Are you able to make this change and let me know when I can publish it out?

Many thanks!

PS Don’t suppose we could make the left-hand nav in Get involved > Education go to the International Inspiration section?

i.e. the link highlighted in the grab below takes you via the splash page? Or is that not possible?

[cid:image001.png@01CBBE3F.FF45C250]

Hi Morag,

These are now switched over (the hub ins the index page), the link on the splash page updated and the hide-in-navigation is enabled on the splash but not the hub page

You just need to publish once your happy.

Jamie

Afraid not, I think the solution is probably for us to have a bit of code we add to the top of splash pages which sets a cookie the first time you visit that page after that you get redirected to the real page seamlessly.

Will have a think and open a separate ticket for it as it's not something we'll get in this week so it will be more for future use if you need it (or indeed we could add it to this page even as soon as next week).

A cookie would be good – would that need to be a change request, as we don’t use cookies currently (do we?)?

Can we look at figuring out a way to manage the preferred navigation method longer term? It’s not top priority, but I know the client will nag away at me if we don’t do it... a bit like we do to you!

No harm in using a cookie like this ie. can't see any reason for a change request, we'd simply set a cookie (stored on a users browser) when they visited that page and in future we'd check to see if they had that cookie and if so redirect them straight to the hub page.

The cookie approach is probably the best solution as you can then make any page a 'splash page for initial visitor only' (I need to double check it wouldn't cause issues with Google not having visibility of the real hub except via the splash page).

I will think about whether we can make a 'splash page' checkbox that if checked overrides the default index page in the left hand navigation, but this will be fraught with complexity if we only want it to appear in certain situations. The important think to realise is that each page doesn't have it's own navigation HTML; there is no International Inspiration local nav (as an individual component) it's just some global logic that builds the nav depending on rules (news and blogs do have their own nav; but these are totally different and date based). I'm slightly loath to go down this route as there is a real danger of it leading to add behaviour which we spend days after the change tidying up.

* I think you are thinking of cookie vs IP based "sessions" which is something a bit different, because you can only fit so much info in a cookie (~128 characters) the web-server stores some information on the server [ie. login name etc] gives that store of information (the session) an ID and then stores that 'session ID' in a cookie on the user browser so that on subsequent pages it can get the session id and then find any info stored for that ID locally on the server. The problem is because we have 6 server and no central session storage, we need to make sure that the user always goes back to the same server or else the information in the 'session' (stored on the server) won't exist. We used to do this based on IP ie. all users from a given IP address always got returned to the same server but post Akamai we had to do this with cookies (as all request appear to the load balancer to come from Akamaki; not sure that is entirely true, but that was the reason I was given). btw. this is that problem of why sometimes it appears as if you are logged out when you are logged in when using https (basically you get sent randomly to different servers each time and because you don't have a 'session' on that server it thinks you are logged out)
Great – let’s go with the cookie then and see how we get on! Sounds like the easiest option by far!

- need to set a cookie in header that is checked/set the first time a user visits the page
- redirect (*) to a real hub page if cookie is set (ie. a subsequent visit) [meta data property? same as link on page?]
- need to set splash page to index.php 
- need to set hub page to hub.php (and hide from nav)

* it may me more sensible to actually load the hub.php page *in place* of the splash (index.php) page, ie. read/output the hub.php page and close connection once it is displayed. this way we keep to one url the user experience is nicer.

** need to fully test on dev before deployment

subject: Apparent discrepancy in Festival signups report
description:
e.g. comparing the reports from Aug 1st and 8th:

Aug 1: All Users	31 Jul 2011	23
Aug 8: All Users	31 Jul 2011	20

In general, the number of festival signups for any given date appears to fall with each successive weekly report.

comments.value:
e.g. comparing the reports from Aug 1st and 8th:

Aug 1: All Users	31 Jul 2011	23
Aug 8: All Users	31 Jul 2011	20

In general, the number of festival signups for any given date appears to fall with each successive weekly report.

Hi Wahome,
For the purpose of this report, the "date" is the date upon which the user last modified their profile.
If a user who appeared in the totals for 31 Jul then comes back and amends their profile in some way (e.g. changing their address/postcode/other) then they will appear in the totals for day upon which they returned.
We don't actually store a profile history - i.e. for each user we do not store a history of exactly when they completed each part of their profile. We simply store a creation data and a last-modified date.
I hope this makes sense, but I'm happy to clarify if it doesn't!
Kind regards,
Kieran

Hi Tom,

No it's not as simple as it sounds, we actually have a ticket open which I have been working on a response to.

Part of the problem is we can't easily dependency track all the pages that use that thumbnail (homepage, venue pages, hub pages etc.) and hence which pages need to be automatically republished. We also have the problem that the image isn't currently replaced / suppressed, only the main page that shows the image and possible links to that page.

The ideal solution would probably be a mix of suppression (when a checkbox is checked, we won't return this webcam to hub pages and/or components) but also to replace the image itself (and all the various repurposing / thumbnails of the image) with a holding image, the tricky thing is here is to stop the feed overwriting the 'holding image' when it next runs.

In short, the above is not something we can get in place this afternoon although we can try and push forward the priority on this work.

You should however be able suppress the webcam (via the checkbox on the page) and then republish the page, the homepage and hub pages, I think if you do that the webcam will be removed from the hub and homepage.

Jamie

subject: Ticketing website checker - Paralympic update
description:
Oh dear.

With the advent of Paralympic ticket sales on 9 September it seems that we need to review our Ticketing website checker. Most of the Paralympic ticket agents are not the same as the Olympic ticket agents, but some of the agents will do both - but not necessarily for hte same countries. (Sorry if that sounds complicated...)

So we might end up with a scenario where one ticket agent has a listing for each Games, with different countries for each Games e.g. this might be the entry for jetsetsports.com:

Olympic Games Tickets
Jet Set Sports is an Olympic Authorised Ticket Reseller for the following countries only: Austria, Bulgaria, Canada, United States of America, Norway, Sweden, Australia. 

Paralympic Games Tickets
Jet Set Sports is an Paralympic Authorised Ticket Reseller for the following countries only: United States, Norway.
 

Is it possible therefore to amend the Ticketing website checker to have additional country fields - for Paralympic agents? Then we can go through and either add in Para-only ticket agents or amend the Olympic agents to also feature Para countries. We would also need to amend the display text to provide for the option of Para countries.

Does that make sense? The timeline for this is not generous - 9 September is when we launch Para sales. Is it even do-able to make that date or do we need to look at a later date? We also need a couple of days to get the data into the tool.

Thanks!

Morag,

In the backend is it enough to just add a flag for Paralympic suppliers (ie. this supplier also sells Paralympic tickets) or do some suppliers have a different sets of countries for the Paralympics.
https://new2012.kitsite.com/kit/data/ticketagents

I'd imagine the use case you want is for the user to type in the url (regardless of whether it is Olympic or Paralympic) but in the results indicate if this agent is Olympic Only, Paralympic Only or an agent for both. Do all those 3 cases exists? and in the case of 'both' do the countries differ depending on whether the agent is supplying Olympic or Paralympic tickets? ie. can you be a North American Olympic ticket agent but only the Canadian supplier for Paralympic tickets?

In short, do we need:

 "is a Paralympic ticket supplier" (in addition to Olympic tickets)

or

"is only an Olympic ticket supplier"
"is only an Olympic Paralympic ticket supplier"
"is a supplier for both Olympics and Paralympic tickets"

and in the case of "is a supplier for both Olympics and Paralympic tickets" do the countries differ depending on the event (Olympic's or Paralympic's) and how common are the exception (ie. can we just hardcode 1 or 2 exception in the code?)

Sorry probably all answered in the spreadsheet, but if you have digested the data already thought you may already know the answer.

thanks

Jamie

Sorry not to have replied on this sooner. :-(

I don’t think it’s enough just to add a flag for Para suppliers, as some suppliers who do both Games have a different sets of countries for the Paralympics.

So we might end up with a scenario where one ticket agent has a listing for each Games, with different countries for each Games e.g. this might be the entry for abc.com:

Olympic Games Tickets
ABC is an Olympic Authorised Ticket Reseller for the following countries only: Austria, Bulgaria, Canada, United States of America, Norway, Sweden, Australia.

Paralympic Games Tickets
ABC is an Paralympic Authorised Ticket Reseller for the following countries only: United States, Norway.

We may also have suppliers who are just Olympic or just Paralympic suppliers.

So I think we need to amend the backend to support additional, Paralympic country fields? Then we can go through and either add in Para-only ticket agents or amend the Olympic agents to also feature Para countries (in the format in bold above). We would also need to amend the display text to provide for the option of Para countries.

So to answer your question, in the backend is it not enough to just add a flag for Paralympic suppliers.

In short, we need:

or

"is an Olympic ticket supplier for .."
"is a Paralympic ticket supplier for ... "
" is an Olympic ticket supplier for .. is a Paralympic ticket supplier for .."

In terms of timescale, obviously we go live with Para tix on 9 September. Is this remotely possible – or are we looking at next week? Grateful for your thoughts!

Hi Morag,

Will add in an extra Paralympic country fields today. 

In terms of the front end, the short answer should probably no for the 9th, but we will see what I can do !!

Let me have a delve round in the code to remind myself what would be involved, before we think if we'll need to come up with a plan b or scale back the requirements for the 9th (not that it's obvious what we'd scale back)

Hi Morag,

You should be abel to update existing agents with Paralympic countries 
https://new2012.kitsite.com/kit/data/ticketagents

In terms of adding new agents with only Paralympic countries can you hold off on those for now as I'll need to stop them appearing as Olympic ticket agents in advance of a more intelligent front end.

Thanks for update on this. I’ve updated the existing entries where they do both Olympic and Paralympic. Will wait to hear from you before adding Para-only entries.

As mentioned, if we can put something live tomorrow, even if visually impaired, that would be great. But if not I’m sure I can find a way to provide the information in text-only form.

Thank you!

Hi Morag,

This is only on staging at the moment, but I think it's doing what you want.
http://locksley.london2012.com/about-this-website/ticketing-website-checker.php

So far I've tested with dertour.de (both) and eventeam2012.fr (Olympic only)

Let me know what you think and if it's OK I'll push it out to live.

Jamie

Hi Michael,

The text is pulled form the meta-description field on the associated index page (or form the title / first para if no meta data field) so update the relevent index page and republish.

You'll then need to preview 'Nav Dropdown' (nav-dropdown.php) with a clear cache parameter like so (as it's a special page that gets cached)
http://new2012.kitsite.com/kit/preview/includes/nav-dropdown.php?mode=publish&cache=false

Lastly, if that looks OK then just republish 'Nav Dropdown' 
/includes/nav-dropdown.php

Jamie
